alert.note: Alert for Sandoval; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 28 at 10:46PM MST until December 28 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Central Santa Fe County in north central New Mexico... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 1045 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Frijoles to San Felipe Pueblo, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 248 and 298. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 279 and 290. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Santo Domingo Pueblo, Cerrillos Hills State Park, Canada De Los Alamos, San Felipe Pueblo, Lamy, Kewa Pueblo, Hyde Memorial State Park and La Bajada. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and turn on headlights! The visibility will suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected along with snow accumulations. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
